content:
• Tuesday, October 2, 2018
  • ELGX

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (10/02/2018)

    • Top Gainers: ELGX +30.2%. TRVN +17.7%. VTVT +16.0%. TPX +8.5%. OTCQB:CLSK +5.2%.
    • Top Losers: DTEA -13.4%. KALA -8.5%. EPZM -7.3%. OGEN -3.9%. EPE -2.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:34 PM | 5 Comments
  • INTC

    Intel gains, AMD plunges as analyst predicts faster 10nm ramp

    • BlueFin Research Partners says Intel’s (NASDAQ:INTC) 10nm production ramp could begin as early as April, up to six months earlier than current estimates.
    • The firm says Intel is making “significant strides” towards its yield target, prompting supplier discussions about whether the ramp could happen before next June. 
    • Intel shares closed today up 3.6% to $48.10 and gained 0.1% aftermarket. 
    • Rival AMD (NASDAQ:AMD) closed down 7.6% to $29.02 and drops 0.3% after hours.       
    • Previously: AMD -4.5% on Intel's 10nm supply update (Sept. 28)
    • Previously: Intel, AMD drop as analysts cut expectations (Oct. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM | 332 Comments
  • LSCC

    Lattice Semi closes +6.7% on price target boost

    • Lattice Semiconductor (NASDAQ:LSCC) closed today up 6.7% after Susquehanna raised its price target from $7 to $8. The rating was maintained at Neutral. (Source: StreetAccount).
    • In late August, Lattice appointed AMD’s Jim Anderson as CEO. Anderson had served as the GM and senior VP of AMD’s Computing and Graphics business group.
    • Lattice shares are up 4.4% in the past month, 34.7% in the quarter, and 47.9% YTD.  
     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • NG

    NovaGold Resources beats by $0.01

    • NovaGold Resources (NYSEMKT:NG): Q3 GAAP EPS of -$0.02 beats by $0.01.
    • Cash and term deposits of $165.96M
    • Shares +1.85% post market
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM
  • DGLY

    Digital Ally -2% as stockholders file to sell up to 1.18M shares

    • Digital Ally (NASDAQ:DGLY) is off 2% after hours, in light trading, after a registration statement filing for sale by shareholders of up to 1.18M shares.
    • The shares are of common stock underlying various warrants.
    • Selling shareholders clearing out of their holdings include Brickell Key Investments, Global Equity Funding, Michael Doherty, Royal Roofing, WestPark Capital, Frank Salvatore, Doug Kaiser, Jonathon Bloom, and Brandon Ross. Another holder, Cory Royer, would still hold 47,139 shares (a 0.4% stake) after the offering.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • KALA

    Kala Pharma launches 7.5M-share stock offering; shares down 5% after hours

    • Kala Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:KALA) slips 5% after hours in reaction to its planned public offering of 7.5M common shares. Underwriters over-allotment will be an additional 1.125M shares. Price and terms have yet to be released.
    • Separately, it has closed a $110M credit facility with funds managed by Athyrium Capital Management, LP.
    • The company says it will use the capital to fund clinical trials and a U.S. marketing application for KPI-121 for dry eye disease by year-end and the launch of INVELTYS in early 2019. Topline data from a Phase 3 study of KPI-121 should be available this quarter.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • SIR

    Select Income REIT dips 1.5% after-hours after starting stock offering begins

    • Select Income REIT (NYSE:SIR) drops 1.5% in after-hours trading after Government Properties (NYSE:GOV-OLD) starts a public offering of 24.9M of SIR common shares.
    • The offering is part of Government Properties'  plan to merge with Select Income. GOV will receive all net proceeds of the share sale and agreed to pay all costs associated with the offering.
    • Joint bookrunning managers for the offering are Citigroup, Bank of America Merrill Lynch, and Morgan Stanley. The joint lead managers are RBC Capital Markets and Wells Fargo Securities.
    • Previously: Select Income REIT jumps on merger with Government Properties Income Trust (Sept. 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM | 20 Comments
  • ELGX

    Endologix sees Q3 revenue as high as $34.7M; shares up 1% after hours

    • On a preliminary basis, Endologix (NASDAQ:ELGX) expects Q3 revenue of $34.3M - 34.7M. It also has raised the low end of its 2018 revenue guidance range $5M to $150M (upper limit of $155M).
    • The company is hosting an investor event this afternoon in New York.
    • Shares are up 1% after hours.
    • Update: Shares are up 37% premarket on Wednesday, October 3.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • TPX

    Tempur-Sealy jumps on report of imminent Mattress Firm bankruptcy

    • Tempur-Sealy International (NYSE:TPX) is up 7% in AH trading in a quick break higher following a Reuters report indicating that Mattress Firm could file for bankruptcy within a week.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • EPZM

    Epizyme readies stock offering; shares down 4% after hours

    • Epizyme (NASDAQ:EPZM) slips 4% after hours in reaction to its planned stock offering. Price, volume and terms have yet to be announced.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • FNJN

    Finjan files patent infringement claim against Rapid7

    • Finjan (NASDAQ:FNJN) files a patent infringement complaint against Rapid7 (NASDAQ:RPD) for allegedly violating at least seven patents.
    • Finjan says the filing with the U.S. District Court for the District of Delaware comes after “more than two years of good faith efforts to resolve a patent dispute.” 
    • The Rapid7 products involved in the complaint include the InsightIDR, InsightVM, InsightAppSec, AppSpider, Metasploit, and Komand tech. 
    • Finjan wants a jury trial, court costs, past damages not less than “a reasonable royalty, and enhanced damages for “willful, wanton and deliberate infringement.” 
    • Finjan shares are down 1% to $4.35. 
    • Rapid7 shares are down 0.03% to $36.34.  
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 6 Comments
  • CZR

    Caesars Entertainment higher after upgrade

    • Caesars Entertainment (CZR +1.4%) pokes out a tidy gain after SunTrust Robinson Humphrey assumes coverage on the casino stock with a Buy rating.
    • Investors may also have their eyes on the latest report of gaming revenue out of Pennsylvania, which showed Caesers' Harrah's property gaining some market share against rivals.
    • PA Gaming Control Board data
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM | 2 Comments
  • SYN

    Synthetic Bio files for upsized $46M equity offering; shares up 2%

    • Synthetic Biologics (SYN +2.3%) has filed an updated preliminary prospectus for a $46M offering of Class A and Class B Units, up from $40M a couple of weeks ago (incorrectly reported as a $20M offering).
    • Previously: Synthetic Biologics up 161% (Sept. 28)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 3 Comments
  • GOLD

    Gold pushes near two-week high, miners sport strong gains

    • Gold futures settled back above $1,200/oz. to reach their highest levels in nearly two weeks, boosted by jitters surrounding Italy’s financial picture, lifting prices for the precious metal to their highest closing level in nearly two weeks.
    • December Comex gold settled +1.3% at $1,207/oz., after gold futures fell 4.6% in Q3 and slid 7.8% YTD.
    • “The speed of today’s rally in precious metals suggests rapid short-covering by hedge funds and other speculators who were betting against bullion,” says Adrian Ash, director of research at BullionVault.
    • Gold’s strength is “impressive given the dollar is not weaker,” says GoldCore's Mark O’Byrne. “Gold is very oversold and due a bounce.”
    • Today's rally briefly positioned gold futures for a settlement above its 50-day moving average of $1,207.44/oz. for the first time since April before falling just short.
    • Gold mining shares are broadly higher: ABX +4.7%, NEM +2.8%, AU +3.1%, GG +3.2%, KGC +2.3%, AEM +4.6%, FNV +3.5%, AUY +2.6%, IAG +4%, GOLD +3.3%, RGLD +2.6%, GFI +5.1%, SBGL +7.3%.
    • ETFs: GLD, GDX, NUGT, GDXJ, JNUG, GGN, DUST, IAU, PHYS, JDST, SGOL, GOEX, UGLD, SGDM, UGL, DGP, GLL, ASA, GTU, GLDI, OUNZ, RING, DZZ, SGDJ, DGL, DGLD, TGLDX, DGZ, PSAU, GOAU, GDXX, GYEN, BAR, GEUR, GDXS, GLDW, GHS, UBG, QGLDX, GHE, MELT, AAAU, GLDM, IAUF
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM | 33 Comments
  • FTR

    Frontier among top gainers with 11% move

    • Frontier Communications (NYSE:FTR) is among today's top-gaining stocks, up 10.8% on volume that's just slightly ahead of normal.
    • There's no apparent news as traders scratch for a reason for the move. Short percentage of float sat at 60.4% as of last month, while short percentage of shares outstanding was 29.3%.
    • Average volume has been lighter lately, while over the past quarter it's been about 3.2M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:10 PM | 21 Comments
  • FTR

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (10/02/2018)

    • Gainers: FTR +12%. RUN +11%. ATOM +9%. APDN +8%. SYNC +8%.
    • Losers: NEON -11%. NETE -11%. OTCPK:LFIN -11%. NCTY -10%. MTSL -10%.
      •    
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 4 Comments
  • MDB

    Recent tech IPOs drop after MongoDB downgrade

    • Newly public tech companies are feeling the pressure today in part due to Nomura’s downgrade of MongoDB (MDB -3.9%) from Reduce to Neutral.
    • Analyst Christopher Eberle says the company’s “current market value reflects extreme valuation.”
    • Other movers: Zscaler (ZS -3.4%), Carbon Black (CBLK -6.1%), DocuSign (DOCU -6.1%), Arlo Technologies (ARLO -5.4%), Zuora (ZUO -0.5%).
    • Dropbox (DBX +1%) is gaining after Nomura gave it an upgrade from Neutral to Reduce, per StreetAccount. 
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM | 22 Comments
  • ACET

    Generics in the green following proposed favorable guidance from FDA

    • Most generic drug firms are enjoying an uptick in buying. This morning, FDA Commissioner Scott Gottlieb, M.D., released a statement on preliminary guidance aimed at making the review process for generic drug applications more efficient.
    • Selected tickers: (ACET +4.9%)(ACRS -1.7%)(AKRX +3.2%)(AMPH -1.1%)(AMRX -1.5%)(ANIP -1.1%)(CHRS -0.4%)(COLL +0.4%)(EGRX +0.1%)(ENDP +2.2%)(LCI +1.1%)(MNK +2.6%)(PRGO +1.2%)(MYL +2.5%)(RDY +0.5%)(TLGT -1.3%)
    • Previously: FDA issues new draft guidance aimed at speedier generic approvals (Oct. 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:03 PM | 8 Comments
  • IGC

    Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (10/02/2018)

    • Gainers: OTC:IGC +34%. PBR +9%. UAN +7%. PRT +7%. SID +7%
    • Losers: REI -17%. SAEX -11%. GBR -10%. NGVT -8%. OTC:JONE -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • SHOO

    Apparel sector bid down on mix of news

    • Apparel stocks trade weak on the day on a mix of news seen as potentially troublesome for the sector. Filtering in today are a downgrade on Steven Madden (SHOO -3.7%) from Wedbush on tariff concerns, weak guidance from Stitch Fix (SFIX -32.6%) and the potential for labor inflation across the sector after Amazon hiked its minimum wage.
    • Decliners include Vera Bradley (VRA -4.8%), Crocs (CROX -4.2%), Fossil (FOSL -2.9%), Deckers Outdoor (DECK +0.9%), Foot Locker (FL -3.3%), Wolverine World Wide (WWW -2.6%), Caleres (CAL -2.1%) and Rocky Brands (RCKY -2.3%), Vince Holdings (VNCE -5.9%), G-III Apparel (GIII -5.6%), Macy's (M -2%), Kohl's (KSS -2.1%), Under Armour (UAA -3.9%), Michael Kors (KORS -2.5%), Canada Goose (GOOS -2.6%), Gap (GPS -3.2%), Nordstrom (JWN -2.2%) and Ralph Lauren (RL -2.7%).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 4 Comments
  • CIEN

    Infinera +3.2% with Morgan Stanley hopeful on CenturyLink decision

    • Infinera (INFN +3.2%) is higher today amid another analyst's hopeful take on the fate of its relationship with key customer CenturyLink.
    • Shares spiked this afternoon to a gain of as much as 6.1% before settling back to its solid steady 3.2% gain.
    • Yesterday's debate centered on MKM's take that Infinera would lose CenturyLink as a customer to a rival like Ciena (CIEN +0.6%); Infinera pushed back against that report with a statement later that said CenturyLink hadn't made a final decision on the matter.
    • Now Morgan Stanley's Meta Marshall says that while losing CenturyLink wouldn't be a positive, the company's statement holds out opportunity through the end of the year. The firm's keeping Infinera at the top of its Optical Scorecard, and says its bull case has Infinera gaining share to reach a $20 price based on EPS of $1.50-$2.00, while the share-losing bear case has Infinera at $4. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Marshall's base-case target is $9.50 (EPS of $0.75-$1.00).
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • VTVT

    Vtv Therapeutics up 122%

    • Thinly traded nano cap vTv Therapeutics (VTVT +121.6%) rockets on a whopping 121x surge in volume.
    • The company just filed an 8-K disclosing that top investor MacAndrews & Forbes Group, controlled by noted investor Ronald Perelman, just bought another 1,879,699 Class A common shares at $1.33 per share pursuant to a July 30 agreement. Its stake is now over 36M shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM | 8 Comments
  • NGVT

    Ingevity -8% as Berenberg downgrades to Hold from Buy

    • Shares of specialty chemicals manufacturer Ingevity (NGVT -7.9%) tumble nearly 8% after Berenberg downgrades to Hold from Buy with a $110 price target, trimmed from $115, on valuation after rising 47% YTD.
    • Berenberg's Paretosh Misra says the spot price weakness in fatty acids and gum rosin commodities may hurt pricing in parts of NGVT's performance chemicals business.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM
  • ATLC

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (10/02/2018)

    • Gainers: ATLC +9%. BSBR +9%. BBD +8%. GGAL +8%. BMA +8%.
    • Losers: YIN -12%. JP -10%. JTPY -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM | 2 Comments
  • NGM

    NASH players under pressure following Liver Meeting abstract drop

    • Biotechs developing treatments for nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) and other fatty liver diseases are seeing some action following the release of abstracts for November's Liver Meeting in San Francisco.
    • Raymond James' Steven Seedhouse says the weakness in ENTA and ICPT is due to weak FXR agonist data from GILD.
    • A new NASH player is looming IPO NGM Biopharmaceuticals (NGM) with lead candidate NGM282.
    • Selected tickers: (VKTX -4.6%)(MDGL -1.1%)(GILD +1%)(CBAY -2.4%)(ENTA -5.2%)(ICPT -5.4%)(RGLS)(INNT -1.5%)(CNAT -0.7%)(WVE -3.3%)(IONS -3.2%)(OTCPK:GNFTF -4.2%)(REGN +2.7%)(ALNY -0.7%)(ASMB -1.2%)(CANF -1.6%)(DRRX)(GLMD +4.7%)(IMRN -3.9%)(GEMP -2.4%)(ORMP -1.5%)(AGN +0.8%)(VBLT +2.4%)(SHPG +0.7%)(DRNA +1.2%)(HZNP +0.1%)(ARCT)(RETA -4.4%)(FGEN +1.1%)
    • Previously: NGM Biopharmaceuticals on deck for IPO (Oct. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 50 Comments
  • OGEN

    Midday Gainers / Losers (10/02/2018)

    • Gainers: OGEN +92%. DTEA +62%. OTC:IGC +58%. TRPX +49%. IMTE +43%. SLS +22%. SYN +20%. FTFT +19%. ATRS +19%. INO +18%.
    • Losers: ABIO -32%. SFIX -32%. ACST -26%. REI -17%. MESO -15%. ADRO -14%. YIN -12%. NVCN -12%. AVRO -12%. NETE -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM | 1 Comment
  • EA

    Report: Slowdown for 'Fortnite' may be just in time for EA, Activision

    • There may be some good news for videogame giants wrestling with the craze for Epic Games' battle-royale hit Fortnite, as M Science's TickerTags sees a turn in social media signaling a slowdown.
    • Twitter mentions (an indicator of daily payers and bookings) are declining for the first time on a season launch day, TickerTags says -- 37% lower than for season 5, 29% lower than season 4 and 13% lower than for season 3.
    • That coincides with key holiday releases introducing their own battle royale modes in response: Blackout in Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 (ATVI +0.4%), and Firestorm in Battlefield V (NASDAQ:EA).
    • Tencent (TCEHY -2%) owns 40% of Epic.
    • Source: Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 17 Comments
  • AOBC

    Firearms stocks track lower for second consecutive day

    • Firearms-related stocks are down again as the impact of federal action on a bump-stocks accessory ban is assessed by investors.
    • Yesterday, President Trump said preparations for the ban were in their final stages.
    • Tracking lower in mid-day trading are American Outdoor Brands (AOBC -1.2%), Sturm, Ruger (RGR -1.1%), Vista Outdoors (VSTO -1.3%) and Sportsman's Warehouse (SPWH -2.3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 5 Comments
  • MU

    Semi stocks trade up with few catalysts

    • Semiconductor stocks are on the move heading into the afternoon without a load of associated catalysts.
    • Gainers include Micron (MU +3.1%), Analog Devices (ADI +1.3%), Intel (INTC +5%) and Lam Research (LRCX +2.4%), which are potentially rebounding after yesterday’s analyst cuts. Intel could also make an appearance at today's Microsoft fall event.
    • More gainers: (ON +2.4%), (SGH +4%), (UCTT +1.4%), (AMKR +2%), (OLED +1.7%), (ICHR +1.5%), (SMTC +1.2%), (QRVO +1.5%), (SQNS +1.4%), (MRVL +1.1%), (SWKS +1.5%), (AMAT +2.2%).
    • AMD (AMD -3.4%) is heading in the opposite direction possibly because of yesterday’s launch of Google’s Project Stream in-browser gaming test program. But the company also had an analyst downgrade yesterday and dropped last Friday as rival Intel updated its 10nm chip supply.
    • The Philadelphia Semiconductor Index is currently up 1.2%.
    • Previously: Microsoft could reveal new Surface models today (Oct. 2)
    • Previously: AMD -4.5% on Intel's 10nm supply update (Sept. 28)
    • Previously: Deutsche and Mizuho throw in towel on semi, NAND stocks (Oct. 1)
    • Previously: Intel, AMD drop as analysts cut expectations (Oct. 1)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM | 118 Comments
  • REI

    Ring Energy -18% after Seaport cuts shares to Neutral from Buy

    • Ring Energy (REI -17.5%) plunges to a 52-week low after Seaport Global downgrades shares to Neutral from Buy with a $12 price target, cut from $20.
    • Seaport analyst John Aschenbeck says he reviewed state data obtained from DrillingInfo and concluded that REI's 2018 San Andres completions have been underperforming older vintages by ~25% and his prior type curve estimates by 34%.
    • Shares already have tumbled by more than 50% since early May, and has suffered six downward Q3 EPS estimate revisions over 60 days, dragging the consensus estimate down to $0.13 from $0.16.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM | 12 Comments
  • SYNC

    Synacor +6% after corporate update presentation

    • Synacor (NASDAQ:SYNC) continues to gain from yesterday’s corporate presentation highlighting its cloud-based software business and growth strategies.
    • The details include an update to Syancor’s recurring-revenue software business, blockchain enhancements to the Zimbra collaboration platform, and cost-reduction plans. 
    • See the presentation slides here. 
    • Synacor shares are up 6.1% to $2.03.  
     
     
     
     
    | 12:18 PM | 1 Comment
  • IGC

    India Globalization Capital a "gift" short - Citron

    • "If you are able to short, it is a gift," tweets Andrew Left.
    • "No product. All hype. Raised Money 2 weeks ago at $1.15  Finger traders will get burned. This hype stock is the poster child of a cannabis bubble. Always cautious but nothing but air. Could write pages about this scheme."
    • India Globalization Capital (OTC:IGC) is up 43% today to $12.89.
    • Update at 12: 35 ET: Citron makes a correction, noting IGC has raised capital three times in three weeks at an average price of $3.31. "Stock should have a skull and crossbones at Fidelity ... Target price - $6 fast."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 25 Comments
  • DTEA

    Consumer - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (10/02/2018)

    • Gainers: DTEA +34%. KNDI +11%. FFHL +9%. LW +9%. SEED +8%.
    • Losers: NBEV -13%. KOSS -6%. VNE -6%. GIII -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • MO

    Altria on watch after FDA seizes Juul documents

    • Altria (MO +0.8%) breaks higher after CNBC reports on a surprise inspection of Juul by the FDA that included the "seizing" of more than a thousand documents.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:41 AM | 50 Comments

  • Rare rally for precious metals

    • Gold today is ahead 1.4% to $1,209 per ounce, while silver is up 2.8% to $14.92.
    • Bloomberg notes gold has moved above its 50-day moving average - the metal hasn't closed above that metric since April.
    • Possibly behind the buying is the continued slow-motion meltdown in Italy, where stocks are down another 1.2%, and the yield on the country's 10-year paper is higher by 10.5 basis points to 3.412%. That's nearly a full 200 basis point higher than Spain, and less than 100 basis points behind the yield on Greek 10-years.
    • Previously: Euro weakens on Italian political risk (Oct. 2)
    • ETFs: GLD, SLV, IAU, AGQ, PSLV, PHYS, USLV, SIVR, SGOL, ZSL, SLVO, GTU, GLDI, OUNZ, DSLV, DBS, GYEN, BAR, GEUR, GHS, USV, SHNY, QGLDX, GHE, DULL, AAAU, GLDM
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM | 19 Comments
  • XENT

    Intersect ENT up 4% on Anthem coverage of Sinuva implant

    • Thinly traded Intersect ENT (XENT +4%) is up on average volume on the heels of Anthem's coverage of its Sinuva (mometasone furoate) Sinus implant for the treatment of nasal polyps.
    • Previously: FDA OKs Intersect ENT's Sinuva sinus implant; shares up 17% (Dec. 11, 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • OGEN

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (10/02/2018)

    • Gainers: OGEN +83%. ATRS +15%. INO +13%. CTXR +11%. CLRB +11%.
    • Losers: ABIO -33%. ACST -17%. MTNB -14%. MESO -14%. ADRO -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 1 Comment
  • NNDM

    Nano Dimension +5.6% on doubling its Armed Forces sales

    • Nano Dimension (NASDAQ:NNDM) announces the sale of two additional DragonFly Pro precision additive manufacturing systems to different branches of the U.S. Armed Forces.
    • The new sale brings the total number of Armed Forces customers to four since the company received a commercial and government entity code from the Department of Defense in June. 
    • NNDM shares are up 5.6% to $2.03.  
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 2 Comments
  • APDN

    Applied DNA Sciences +11% on securing RNA therapeutic customers

    • Applied DNA Sciences (NASDAQ:APDN) continues to gain on yesterday’s announcement that subsidiary LineaRx secured multiple new developers of RNA therapeutics as customers for its contract research organization services.
    • Terms weren’t disclosed. 
    • APDN shares are up 11% to $1.56.  
     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • PEP

    PepsiCo dips after earnings

    • PepsiCo (PEP -1%) trades slightly lower after releasing earnings this morning.
    • Analysts note that the company topped estimates through the help of a lower effective tax rate, but that underlying margins weren't as strong as anticipated.
    • On the conference call (webcast), PepsiCo management reminded that its beverage price increases weren't in effect until September and (as expected) says it's sitting out the cannabis craze at least until federal regulations become clearer.
    • Previously: PepsiCo beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (Oct. 2)
    • Previously: PepsiCo beats Q3 estimates, revised FY2018 guidance (Oct. 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 13 Comments
  • ATOM

    Atomera pops 11.5% on license deal with STMicroelectronics

    • Atomera (NASDAQ:ATOM) announces that STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM) has signed an integration license for Atomera’s Mears Silicon Technology (MST), which enhances transistors.
    • The license gives ST certain rights to integrate the MST tech into their products and will serve as the first of a three-phase process. The next two licensing phases will involve manufacturing and distribution.
    • Financial terms weren’t disclosed.
    • Atomera shares are up 11.5% to $6.13.
    • STMicroelectronics shares are up 2.8% to $18.79.   
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • LW

    Lamb Weston rallies after earnings

    • Lamb Weston (NYSE:LW) is up 5.9% after turning in a Q2 earnings report that topped consensus estimates. Analysts are pointing to Lamb Weston's combination of volume and price/mix gains as a positive sign.
    • The company also reaffirmed its FQ1 and FY19 guidance.
    • Previously: More on Lamb Weston Q1 results (Oct. 2)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:37 AM
  • MLNX

    Jefferies sees 50% upside to Mellanox

    • Mellanox Technologies (NASDAQ:MLNX) gains 4% after Jefferies initiates the company at Buy with a $110 price target, a 50% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Source: StreetAccount.
    • MLNX is down 10% in the past month, 15% in the quarter, but gained 13.5% YTD and 55.8% in the past year. 
    • Mellanox is expected to report earnings on October 24.  
    • Previously: Mellanox Tech +1.5% on Q2 beats, upside Q3 and FY guide (July 17)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • GE

    Moody's places GE credit rating under review for possible downgrade

    • General Electric's (GE -2.6%) A2 credit rating is under review for a possible downgrade at Moody's, which cites GE's announcement that it will fall short of its 2018 earnings and free cash flow guidance amid weak performance from its power business.
    • "Among the range of issues that Moody's will consider is the impact on GE's earnings and cash flow prospects of the continuing deterioration in its Power business, which is likely to persist for some time," Moody's says.
    • "The dimmer prospects for GE Power take on heightened importance given the loss of free cash flow from GE's planned divestitures, including the highly cash generative GE Transportation and GE Healthcare," according to the ratings agency.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 18 Comments

  • RNN

    Rexahn Pharma's RX-3117 shows positive action in mid-stage pancreatic cancer study; shares up 4% premarket

    • Rexahn Pharmaceuticals (NYSEMKT:RNN) is up4%premarket on light volume on the heels of its announcement of preliminary data from its Phase 2a clinical trial evaluating RX-3117, combined with Celgene's Abraxane (nab-paclitaxel), for the first-line treatment of patients with pancreatic cancer. The results were presented at the NCI Pancreatic Cancer Symposium in Bethesda, MD.
    • The disease control rate (responders + those with stable cancer) was 86% (n=12/14), including one complete responder (after six cycles of therapy) and three partial responders (two after two cycles of treatment and the other after four cycles). The overall response rate was 29% (n=4/14).
    • Final data should be available in 2019.
    • RX-3117 is an orally available small molecule nucleoside compound. Once activated by an enzyme called UCK2, it is incorporated into cancer cells where it induces cell death by inhibiting DNA and RNA synthesis. UCK2 is overexpressed in a range of cancer cells.
    • Previously: Rexahn's RX-3117 shows positive effect in mid-stage bladder cancer study (Feb. 12)

  • ARNA

    Arena Pharma's ralinepag shows durable treatment effect in mid-stage PAH extension study; shares up 1% premarket

    • Arena Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:ARNA) is up 1% premarket, albeit on only 100 shares, on the heels of its announcement of positive long-term data from an open-label extension of a Phase 2 clinical trial evaluating ralinepag, a prostacyclin receptor agonist, in patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension (PAH).
    • Patients who continued on ralinepag had a median duration of treatment of 1.8 years at the time of right heart catheterization. They showed sustained improvements from baseline pulmonary vascular resistance (PVR) (a measure of the extent that pulmonary circulation "resists" cardiac output) and 6-minute walk test distance. The separation from control was statistically significant.
    • Patients switching from placebo to ralinepag (median duration of treatment = 1.4 years) experienced similar statistically valid sustained treatment benefits.
    • Most of the patients were already receiving dual combination PAH background therapy.
    • No new safety signals were observed.
    • Ralinepag is currently in Phase 3 development.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:32 AM | 6 Comments

    • The FDA grants Breakthrough Therapy designation for Clovis Oncology's (NASDAQ:CLVS) Rubraca (rucaparib) as a monotherapy treatment of adult patients with BRCA1/2-mutated mCRPC who have received at least one prior androgen receptor (AR)-directed therapy and taxane-based chemotherapy.
